description:
"Oh no, not another burrito review from Matt G!"

Damn right, I love my burritos and nobody can take that away from me. Now give me a kiss!

In all seriousness, who would've thought you can get a solid silver bullet from the NoPa area? For $10.00, which is the average cost in the area, I get a grilled Carne Asada, fresh and sharp cheddar cheese, a perfect amount of guacamole, sour cream, salsa, beans and rice in a flour tortilla. The grilled steak had a nice crunch and bursting with smoky flavor. The taqueria also offer different kinds of tortillas. But I am cool with the standard white tortilla as the wrap. 

You know I got to have a brew with my wrap. The taqueria also sell Sierra Nevada Pale Ale and a few draught brews for $4.50 a bottle. Now my meal is complete. 

The salsa bar has various condiments including grilled onions and mushrooms. Those two are very popular and goes very quickly. 

This is one of few along the Divisadero Street strip and NoPa area. But the food from this taqueria is really good. The cleanliness is a bit a work in progress. But I am all about a good burrito.
author: Matt G.

description:
It's a really nice place for eating your heart out. The service is nice and kind, portions are huge and the price is very reasonable.

They have a plethora of salsa options in the salsa bar which go well with the chips you get after you place your order. I ordered the chicken flautas (corn fried chicken rolls) which came with a side of rice, beans, gauc and sour cream. Everything was how you want your food to be when you're extremely hungry. I've tried their chicken enchiladas before and frankly, I liked that better than the flautas. 

This place is open till late night and is definitely on my places to frequent!
author: Akshat G.

description:
Awesome taco spot! It was our very last night in SF and we really want to end with a good food spot, especially the last taco spot we tried right before this place, was a huge disappointment. It was just about 10:30 pm at night, we walked out of our hotel with pajamas and we were determined get better tacos here. 

When we got here, it was already looking better because this is how a taco spot is supposed to look! We saw the garnish bar where you can grab your red sauce, green sauce, beets, limes, and etc. Yes!!! For the food, we ordered three tacos: lengua, al pastor, and carnitas. We also got a side of guacamole to go with it. All three tacos were really good! Lengua Taco had to be my favorite. Each bite was the perfect mouth-sized and the meat was so tender that it just melts in my mouth. Al Pastor was a close second, I probably would like more pineapple bites in mine. Carnitas was also tender and flavorful as well. 

We were both so satisfied with the tacos and could leave SF with a happy stomach!
author: Cynthia D.

description:
For Mexican food in San Francisco, this place is very average for its price.

I got the Grilled Vegetable bowl and Super-ed it to add ingredients like guac, rice, beans and sour cream. The ingredients overall seem a bit subpar. The beans are not fully cooked, the rice felt more grainy than usual and the guac was not as tasty. I felt the vegetables tended to dominate each bite a bit more than the other ingredients, which are supposed to have more flavor. There was also free chips and salsa. The salsas were fantastic but the chips were extremely hard and tough to eat.

I would recommend coming here if you're in the area, but maybe go for one of the specialty plates or something.
author: Sampath D.

description: I got the super veggie burrito with no sour cream and it was pretty good but not spectacular. The place was crowded and tables weren't bussed right away but they did take care of it and I'd go there again when I'm in the neighborhood
author: John R.

description:
This place is one of the first places that I pinpointed  as a must try on my new Togo list. It's located in a pretty active part of town with restaurants everywhere and bars every other where.

This place has a lot of variety and choices. Looking at the menu, I thought it best to get the "super" tacos. Being a taco aficionado (look at my history), I assumed 2 regular tacos wouldn't fill me up. I got the al pastor and the lengua (pleasant surprise, no upcharge). 

When they came out with my tacos, I was shocked. The super taco is called super taco for a reason. It's topped with all kinds of things with 2 corn tortilla (each) under all the toppings. It was delicious and super filling. The pastor and lengua were very well executed.

The staff is really nice and laid back. The place isn't big but it's average/on the larger sized for that area. 

Definitely would recommend.
author: Chris C.

description:
Smackin!! Lots of foot traffic but service was still quick. Got the super burrito with carne asada - authentic AND tasty. Their salsa bar was pretty good too.

This spot is near Emporium SF which allows outside food. Grab their food and bring it with you to Emporium!

Suggestion: For even better service, they can empty out the trash/food tray bins more frequently. All of them were stacked up noticeably high.
author: Bryan R.

description:
You know what?! This place isn't bad?! They have a big menu with lots of options to choose from, unlimited salsa bar, opened late night, AND they accept Visa & MasterCard. This is a huge plus!

I personally like their food! It's a great alternative to El Faros. I ordered a steak & shrimp burrito which was delicious and had the right balance of ingredients and flavors. The shrimp was meaty and their carne asada was grilled just right. Their food isn't salty either, which is always a plus. It's a bit expensive for the food by maybe $2-$3 compared to other hole in the walls but because they take cards and opened late, it doesn't bother me. 

Me and my friends had an excellent time here and will definitely stop-in again.
author: Allister D.

description:
Summary: Great service and large portions at a cheap price that will make your mouth water and stomach super happy!

My friends and I came here for the first time and ordered their nachos and wet burrito. That was our first mistake, ordering two dishes with two people because the plates came out to be huge! We ended up taking home the leftovers. We thought the carne asada was made just right so that is was still tender and juicy. The burrito was stuffed with lots of meat and had little beans and rice. The salsa, guacamole, and sour cream poured over the burrito were also paired really well. As for the nachos, it was also layered with delicious carne asada, beans, tomatoes, and guacamole.  

Aside from the dishes we ordered, we were also given chips on the side and there's a complimentary condiment station across from the cashier. The service was great. As first time comers, we didnt know whether if we should wait for the food at the cashier as it seemed like a fast food place, but the lady told us to sit down and later brought the food to us.
author: 'Cindy V.

description:
Might be a lil blasphemous but......  better than the Mission places (imo)......  EEK!!

I've only had the quesadilla (many, many times).  Friends had the burritos & tacos...  They liked 'em.

I get - Pollo asado, super quesadilla (Guac, salsa & sour cream on the side).  It's huge, meaty, cheesy, flavor packed and somehow the flour tortilla is still crispy.  They just don't make it like this in the Mission and it's on par price wise (~$10).  Plus free chips & Salsa bar.  Open til midnight & accepts cards.  Handful of TV's, watched World Cup prelims.          

Good Lord.  Need a fix, STAT.

See pic (and that's only a half!!): https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/el-rancho-grande-san-francisco?select=0baB5Nds30_OM52uvCD1fw&userid=WQ41N9RsEa8I1HVivYo3iQ
author: CatwomanRoar M.

description:
Best tacos in the Divisadero corridor. Consistently delicious, great service, and super nice people behind the counter. Plus they take credit card!

There is a huge selection of specials and meats but carne asada is the way to go here. Love the variety of condiments in the salsa bar. Get a small cup of the pickled red onions and habanero if you want to take your taco game to the next level!
author: Joanna X.

description: Love this place! Moved to SF about 4 weeks ago and have already been here 5 times. I've gotten the super quesadilla with pollo en salsa and a fish burrito. I preferred the quesadilla, but all the food I've had from here is delicious and it always comes out quickly. You always get a free basket of nachos, and there's a full free salsa bar that's great. Also, the service has always been very friendly and accommodating. The place itself is very clean and welcoming, with a very clean bathroom as well. I will definitely be back and I recommend this place to everyone!
author: Andrew M.

description: One of the best pastor fries in the city! Guac and sour cream are the perfect top off to the plate! There was so much pastor, enough for each bite with the fries! They are very generous with their portions. Called ahead at 1am on a Saturday and it was a good idea. The place was packed. Every table filled and still a line almost out the door! That how you know ;)
author: Megan M.

description: I love this spot! I live a few blocks away and always will head over here with friends or if I need a late night snack.  My go to is their cheese quesadillas, OMG so oily, cheesy and yummy.  It's the best cure to prevent a hangover the next morning.  I also loved their fish tacos.  They are pricey but very good quality and tasty.  One of my favorite parts about this local spot is that their salsa tastes great and is actually spicy.  I will keep coming back here for some good quality Mexican food.
author: Jordan S.

description: Very hearty and filling burrito for around $10, salsa bar is legit too! Open late is an extra +. There's only 1 cashier and a few cooks so things might take a little time but it's worth the wait
author: Shermond W.

description:
Great Mexican food at fair prices. Friendly staff. Kind of a dive, but very chill. The menudo
Is delicious.
author: Sergio H.

description:
This place is so good for late night hunger pains! I went with a friend and we bumped into another friend of mine at 11PM!! It's down to the basics in terms of seating and such but no one comes here for the ambiance. 

We met up and sat together for some chats and giggles. The tacos are so good I had to order more! It's good portioned, fresh, and packs a lot of flavor. But nothing was too overwhelming. It feels high class but at a really affordable price! That's the best combo I could ever ask for! 

My friend's burrito is really long and fat and he finished it all...

I think this place is so affordable, convenient and better than a lot of places I've had. I will definitely visit again soon.
author: Lana W.

description: Let me be succinct: work till midnight, delicious tacos and you can't beat the price. What else do you need? Great job guys! Love you
author: Galina K.

description:
Fast! Super good salsa bar and they offer a vegetarian version of a Cali burrito you just gotta know how to ask for it! Y'all are crazy for not giving this fine establishment 5 stars! Straight trippin dawgz!

Do yourself a favor. Get the California burrito. You won't be mad.
author: Kelly T.

description: I live in the sunset district area and just so happens this burrito joint is the nearest to open at around 1am compare to Mission, so this place isn't bad at all, warm tortilla and the steaks with melted cheese and best of all.. free salsa bar!! habanero salsa is a plus for me!!!
author: Wallace W.

description: I've eaten here half a dozen times since I moved to the neighborhood. I always get the Burrito Mojado with Carnitas, because it's incredibly delicious. However, every time I eat here, I have GI issues. At first, I wrote it off as a coincidence, because I love the food. But I keep finding myself on the toilet after eating here. This last time was particularly bad, taking several days to recover. I'm bummed to have to give this place up, but it's just not worth it anymore.
author: Ben H.

description:
First and foremost, if you attend USF - this is easily the best Mexican spot near school. I live in the Richmond and the Mexican options are abysmal. On campus, when you look up "Mexican," all you'll get is Papalote (sauce good but food mediocre) or Chipotle.

My review only stands for the tacos and elote. The regular tacos are $2.95 which is pricer for my SJ ass, but better than SF's $3.50 standard. The elote hits the spot for $3. Open salsa bar, and free chips with purchase. Straightforward and I like that this isn't some bougie, gentrified BS. Put money towards POC-owned and local business, y'all.
author: Jacquelyn T.

description:
Rancho is consistently delicious. I've eaten here dozens of times over the past few years. It's definitely one of the city's most underrated, under-appreciated taquerias. The ingredients are always fresh and flavorful. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. Plus it's one of the only affordable restaurants left on Divisadero.

I assume that anyone who gives the place a bad review either has unrealistic expectations for cheap Mexican restaurants or orders online (pro tip: don't order burritos on the internet. There's a 90% chance you live within walking distance of a taqueria. A bumpy 30 minute ride in the back of a crusty delivery car will ruin just about any meal. So take advantage of the fact that you live here and go to restaurants in person!)
author: Austin L.

description:
Best pastor outside of the mission, with really solid chipotle salsa that's actually spicy. Far to much of the chipotle in the world has no umph to it, but theirs really hits the spot. The portions are grande with a particularly chill price point, especially being the only legitimate taqueria around. Nopa has relatively few affordable options for a full meal without having to wash dishes to cover the bill. This nook is a lifesaver for those of us not making a tech wage.

Pro tip - elote (grilled & spiced corn) is super cheap, filling, and ridiculously yummy.

Friendly staff, rarely a line. I'm a fan.
author: Ryan B.

description: So good. They hook it up here! Mushroom quesadillas have other veggies on them too and it's so cheesy and good. Free salsa bar with chips. I'm a native of south central Texas so I feel like I'm at home when I come here :) cheap, too! A single taco is a meal and it's like $5. Can't go wrong!
author: Shelby B.

description: Good assortment of meats for Tacos including Buche and Lengua.  Salsa Bar is always a bonus ! The medium guacamole was pretty darn good for 2 people to split.
author: Moon G.

description: This is my local spot. As divis gets fancier and fancier, it gets harder and harder to find a decent meal on the cheap. Is this place clean? Not particularly. Does it have good, spicy salsa? Absolutely. Is the Al Pastor good? It's the bomb. Personally, I think tacos are far superior to the burritos at this place, but to each their own.
author: Alison H.

description: Loved this place. Chips not worth it, but the super quesadilla with carne asada was HUGE, and the best quesadilla I've ever had. Salsa bar also nice.
author: eliza c.

description: Being a San Francisco native I have been fortunate enough to enjoy the plethora of taquerias in San Francisco throughout my life. As this city has inevitably changed over time, it is nice to have a great spot like El Rancho Grande that continues to serve its loyal customers with great meals. As much as I love their salsas and el pastor, I always come back to this institution on divisadero because of their genuine customer service!
author: Aristos K.

description:
Came here after ordering on yelp and they didn't get our order. Alright, no big deal. After they said it was alright, they retook our order and we waited. 10 minutes later, they hadn't even started on it because they wanted to sort it out. Really? 10 more minutes later, my phone showed me the yelp confirmation and I showed it to them so they got started on it. Really? Even then, they were still working on the yelp glitch.
Took our chimichangas elsewhere to eat because this place is just filthy and well, they were alright. Not great and nothing to tell you about. Everything is very low quality and old tasting. The salsa is bland. The chimichanga was soggy. I don't recommend eating here unless you're tight on cash I guess.
author: Jenn T.

description: My friend David took me here after playing tennis. I got the steak California burrito with french fries. It was very good. I like this spot more than say Papalote. It has real authentic Mexican food with an exciting menu.
author: Denise C.

description:
The food is fresh, flavorful and reasonably priced. Not amazing, but good and inexpensive. Their salsa bar has a good variety of fresh salsas, perfectly grilled peppers and crispy radishes. The music is tasteful, rural, and soulful. True country "a la mexicana."

On the minus, Rancho Grande really needs fewer things on the wall and lighter, fresher paint. Soap dispenser is broken and open, bathroom needs a paint job and to be spic and span. The restaurant tables need to be wiped and floors mopped. The place lacks good fans/ventilation and open windows.

It has great potential. Service is good. Really just needs investment in:

*Proper ventilation
*Paint and hygiene 
*Aesthetics and decor 

Suggestion:

Menu is a bit too much. Fewer dish options would allow for a nicer, cleaner looking menu. It would also lead to fresher food. 

Try it! Enjoy inexpensive comfort food and help this place invest in its growth.
author: Maria Del Carmen M.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood food scene. Standard taqueria fare, well done, plus hearty Mexican soup. Service is a little gruff as others have noted, but part of the experience.
author: Clark W.

description:
This place is really solid. It's quickly rising in the ranks of my personal taqueria preferences. The food is fresh and tasty, it's open late, the menu is varied and vast! Even on a pretty restrictive diet I have many choices here. The people that work here are so nice as well. 

I asked the cashier what her favorite soup was and she said the chicken or the beef. I went with the chicken and was not disappointed. Clear flavorful broth, generous pieces of fall-off-the-bone tender chicken, and good fixings to go along with it. I will definitely order his again and would be happy to try the beef soup as well. 

My roommates love the chicken Mexican salad and order it frequently. So glad I've started to frequent this spot. It's also much more affordable than the other casual dinner spots in the neighborhood.
author: Sam L.

description:
Omg ! Burst of flavors in my mouth and boy they are not stingy with their taco fillings .. and the sauces like 7-9 of them , I have never seen so many of them and one better and unique than the other .

I have had my share of Mexican food( including mission street and Michelin Star ) , but this one will be my fav from now on .

Also .. buh byes to TLC( the little chihuahua ) not paying $15 for a burrito !  All are welcome and they are open till 3:00 am .. I respect establishments that cater to late nighters and much late nighters ..
author: Feedback M.

description:
I have noted El Rancho Grande for years as I picked up my little Star pizza. You know...in the back of your mind you say...I should try that place...but never get around to it.

My hesitation was probably the outside appearance. Sorta like that person that is not the most beautiful but has an amazing personality.

Don't let the outside deter you. Don't let the crazy large diverse menu deter you...yeah I know a cheese steak at a tacqueria is pretty disparate.

El Rancho Grande serves awesome burritos and tacos. The tortilla is grilled just right. Their seasoned rice is great. Their Al Pastor is wonderful. Their Salsa is delish. Portions are crazy big.

Great free Salsa bar with all kinds of great sides: jalapenos, salsas, and marinated veggies.

Burrito comes with chips ( chips are sorta meh)

I definitely like this place and will come here often as the food is fantastic.

Highly recommend

Thanks yelp!!!!
author: David G.

description: I get my steak fries from here and they are very delicious but the way they cut up there meat and vegetables are careless. While eating my fries there was like Chunks of like fat or bones in my plate and then I found a avocado pits in my played. They also had a piece of papers towel in my plate which was a little disturbing. However, the good was great and for the size and serving it is well worth it. Food was great, presentation was great. Take more time in serving the food.
author: Theresa H.

description:
I always get the salad because I love the dressing.  But for $13, I'm pretty tired of them forgetting ingredients or barely putting any of the ingredients that aren't lettuce.

Update: another ingredient forgotten.  I just want to get what I paid for.  This has happened so many times, I'm not coming back.
author: Melissa D.

description: Delicious burrito, delicious salsa bar, terrible margaritas. I'll return for the food for sure
author: Eric B.

description:
Food was decent but service sucks. I ordered on yelp but they claim they never got my order so they charged me twice which I need to call about. 

Also when you walk in they just stare at you, no greeting whatsoever. Then the girls continued to take my order with soooooo much attitude which I don't understand why.

They just threw my chips in the bottom of my Togo bag and no salsa
author: Jennifer D.

description: I got the tostada which I regret. Maybe the chics attitude when she ask are you ready?  or maybe i didnt speak spanish to her.  But i got the grosses looking tostada on earth. The meat was chewy like beef jerky plus it looked like slop. I dont recommend if your looking for good quality mexican food.
author: FoodieBy T.

description: It sucks! Customer service is terrific, they're never open..the food is not tasty, the waitress are rude...i won't go back...don't recommend this place. I went to a Chinese plack back from it and it's much better, I'm not fan of chinese food, but when it comes to customer service...this place sucks
author: Maribel G.

description: This place is BOMB!!!!! Not the fanciest and a lot of people are coming in and out but it doesn't matter bc the food is SOOOO GOOOD! Hands down BEST michelada! All of their items are amazing! I have been there drunk and sober and every time it's just AMAZING! Also nicest people even when they are busy, which is almost always!
author: Cecilia H.

description:
Holy shit. Mission style burrito at its finest. Went with a large group of friends; all got burritos but different meats. 

All of us were blown by the burritos. Salsa is great, maybe a bit not too fresh, but the amazingness of burritos compensated and got rave reviews. 

Will come back whenever in the area.
author: Brandon M.

description: This was the first restaurant I went to when I moved to San Francisco. Little did I know, it would be one of my FAVORITES. This is a very good place to get a SUPER BURRITO
author: Bennett K.

description:
Fantastic California burrito. They fry the fries a little harder so they add a lot of texture. I really only get either the California or super burrito, and usually stick to carnitas.

If you really want to eat an extreme amount of food, the quesadilllas are good also.
author: Chris C.

description:
I'm embarrassed to admit I go here weekly. I'm a vegetarian and Rancho has some delicious options (albeit guilty-pleasure level!). Their super quesadillas with beans instead of meat is my favorite. 

Service is always friendly and efficient. Food is consistently good. I'm grateful to have a down-to-earth and unpretentious restaurant in my neighborhood!
author: Virginia H.

description:
We've found a new neighborhood gem! 

Key points:
Friendly staff
Takes credit cards/debit
Salsa bar
Free (& fresh!) chips
Variety on their menu (including fish tacos)
Big portions 

I got a super taco because I wasn't hungry and found myself committed to a meal! I've never seen such a large taco. I had to eat it with a fork. It was piled high with carne Asada, guac, lettuce, pick de gallo, sour cream and cheese. So much cheese. All for $5 too. 

My buddies seemed to enjoy their orders as well. One got a steak ranchero & the other a chicken burrito. I recommend for a fast tasty meal.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Pretty good mexican food, and open late!  Like, really late on weekends!  Great for getting late night munchies after the bars, and they have a huge variety of mexican food.  Everything from standard burritos and tacos to mexican soup and micheladas!  

Solid late night spot with a wide variety of menu items.  Bonus points for being close to my house for easy late-night access
author: Keith C.

description:
The chips, cold and stale .. flys all over the place inside .. very sparing on meat.. and it was bland Burritos..  
servers were very nice and polite and the place was very busy ..which was a surprise .. 

Maybe they have other specials?
author: Ruth M.

description: I've been here many times and their burritos and quesadillas are pretty good.  Here's the problem - recently the place has started to smell bad.  You walk in and you are hit with this wet dog / rotting something smell and it's no bueno, makes me question every burrito I've ever had there.  I really hope they figure this out and clean it up.
author: Lauren H.

description: Delicious divey Mexican joint! I've been here a couple of times and the staff has been incredibly friendly. My orders have been correct even with multiple modifications. Great burritos however I've only tried the carbs asada. Just moved to the area and this is going to be a late night favorite!
author: Karenna B.

description:
Finally a decent taco spot in SF!!! It is so hard to find good tacos here. People think they know good places and then I think they must not have ever had a decent taco and I cry a little bit inside.

Someone told me this place was great but I was so doubtful I almost left after standing in line for a minute. Glad I didn't. These are great!

Totally normal, tasty, tacos! Theyre a little expensive compared to socal but at least they are good.

Large portions of meat, quality meat, quality other ingredients, a solid salsa bar, totally on point horchata, great service, bright, clean.

Finally have a good taco place in SF!
author: Ryan B.

description: This is my go-to spot for fairly priced, quality Mexican food on Divisadero. Some of my favorites are their Carne Asada tacos and Chili Relleno. They keep it real with prompt service, a great array of salsas, and a classic menu that never disappoints. Also open late, which is always a plus!
author: Shannon A.

description: This place brings me so much joy. Their burritos and quesadillas are incredible. Even their french fries are good. Highly recommend.
author: Ali A.

description: Although i love there tacos today's complaint is regarding customer service. I ordered a super taco chicken, no guac with black beans. I came home to a taco with guac, refried beans and no sour cream. I haven't had refried beans in years. My best friend ordered a shrimp quesadilla and the shrimp wasn't consistent throughout her meal. We are residents of this neighborhood and we should be serviced with better care. If the woman at the counter or chefs behind would have listened/read my request for food i am paying to enjoy, my meal would have been worth it if my order was taken properly.
author: King DJane M.

description:
Came here after a late night out for some munchies. The burritos were pretty good and reasonably priced. Great hot sauces. 

Beware though - they only take cash! ATM on site
author: Max M.

description: One of the best taquerias in the city!! Real authentic Mexican food for a great price. Super friendly staff, the place is not intimidating at all. One of my favorite Taqueria's in the area because of its authenticity.
author: Mike K.

description: I love my neighborhood Mexican spot!! Always yummy & filling! Do yourself a favor and treat yo self!!
author: Blair M.

description:
They were open!
We were driving around San Francisco it's such a beautiful city but very limited on places to eat after midnight.
We stumbled upon this little place and lucky for us,
service was fantastic good crowd and as you can see by my photo the portions were great.
Taste was authentic and the atmosphere just right if you're looking for a place in San Francisco to get your eat on after midnight this is a place for you, BAM!
author: Mike F.

description: Went there last night after laundry. Was pretty busy, and the cashier was really friendly. We were hoping to find that little hole in the wall place that has amazing food. This wasn't it. The horchata was good, honey bunny ate all of his super burrito (he said because all he had that day was a piece of cake). I got a wet burrito and an elote. I didn't know kernals could be that small on a cob. Flavor was pretty good, lips were burning for awhile after. The wet burrito was just off. Couldn't quite put my finger on it. It had sweet undertones. The pastor was bland, except for the char on it ( so burnt flavor). Not very cheesy, and like I said something tasted sweet. It was so off putting that I just couldn't eat it at all. Which when you pay $40 for 3 burritos was so disappointing. In a house of three, they got 3 thumbs down.
author: Monica F.

description: I really wanted to like this place off the stellar yelp reviews but I was a bit disappointed. I had the enchiladas and margarita. I think I just ordered wrong because the super chicken burrito was pretty good. It was freezing in the restaurant with about 8 tables for sitting.
author: Jessie V.

description: Super yummy- got the carne Adams's burrito. Salsas were all fantastic tasting, and the area was super nice an presentable. They take care! The prices are INCREDIBLE- I paid like 13.45 for the reg burrito and a cheeze quesadilla, (which is ONE quesadilla, but described as two corn tortillas- may sound obvious now... but I ordered quick. TINY quesadilla lol.) Burrito was so big I saved the second half for another meal. Will eat here again.
author: Davey S.

description:
Just utter crap food, paired with indifferent service. Do not get all sentimental when this place gets replaced by Gentrification Deli with $14 bagels, because El Rancho Crapo is the Sick Old Man of Divis. Seriously, I only ate there because of the average 4 star review on Yelp, but now will spend my next 5 years working on a time machine so I can go back and stop myself. 
Do. Not. Eat. At. This. Craphole.
author: sellMyFing n.

description:
Huge portions here. I usually order a chimichanga which comes with rice and beans on the side. I always have more than half of it as left overs. Try the barbecue chicken, its sweet and a nice change to the traditional Mexican meats. Each meal comes with free chips and access to their amazing salsa bar. They have at least 12 salsa options. 
I usually take it to go since I live near by but the inside is simple and has TV's to watch sports.
author: Katelyn S.

description: The best damn burrito in SF, hands down. As a Mexican person from San Diego who's eaten her way through every acclaimed burrito in the mission, I have much to compare this place to. It's truly a gem. Every time I eat this burrito I'm shocked at how perfect it is. Amazing carnitas, great rice and beans, no drippiness. El Rancho has a cult following in NOPA and at the risk of increasing popularity to the detriment of wait times, get the super burrito, ask them to grill the outside, and top it with the hot salsa.
author: Amy S.

description:
I'm in town for the weekend and thought I'd check in with Yelp for some inside tips on food. This place had some good reviews.
There were 5 of us and each of us order something different. A California Burrito that I had a bite of was excellent. The carne wasn't super tender (or at least the bite I had) but the taste was fantastic.
The Milanese plate was quite good. The meat wasn't the same as I or my mom used to make but I can't ask for that. The rice and beans with a corn tortilla was sheer comfort food and took me back to childhood. 
My daughter had the fried fish tacos and although i didn't try it she said they were very good. My step daughter had the Super Burrito and I didn't get a chance to try it because it was devoured quite quickly.
I had the Milanesa torta without the sour cream. And that was truly amazing. I wanted another one. The flavors blended quite well and the bread was very fresh.
I would definitely go back on my next trip.
author: Eric P.

description:
Best Horchata and churros ever.  The sweetness and grittiness of the drink are perfect! and the churros have a filling in them that just oozes out when you bite into it.

I really liked all the food I've gotten from this place.  The super burrito and the breakfast burritos are delicious :) The cashier is also super nice.  You get to choose what type of tortilla you want too (spinach, regular, tomato, etc).

Open late (3 am) on weekends so perfect for late night food.
author: Lydia K.

description:
Rancho Grande is one of my go to Mexican spots in SF, and a great place when you are in a hurry.  Located a few blocks from Fell and Divisadero, street parking is usually easy to find.

The tacos are good, the carne asada is moist and the lettuce is cold and crisp. I like the salads also, the caesar salad has lots of meat.  The salsa bar is one of the best in SF.  Spicy salsa, good habanero salsa as well as salsa verde.
author: Marlon T.

description: Hell no!! Never coming back to this place!! The fish fried tacos are too expensive and are terrible
author: Heydy L.

description: Food was great! Agua fresca was so delicious! Had nachos to share with my table, had vegetarian tacos, were so big had a hard time eating them all (in a good way!)
author: Meg M.

description:
Great mexican joint that's priced right for the value. 

Huevos con Jamon breakfast burrito is my favorite item on the menu. Quick service, tasty, and filling. Exactly what I want out of a burrito/mexican spot.
author: Nick W.

description:
No nonsense fajitas make this place a win. Go in, order the shrimp version, and enjoy each bite with the guac that comes with.

So my fiance and I went to grab a bite Saturday afternoon. It was an odd hour, so the restaurant was nearly empty and there was no one in front of us. We took a while to decide but finally ordered a shrimp plate without the cheese, beans, rice or tortilla....

and it STILL turned out  delicious. Why did we take out so many ingredients? We're not on a low carb diet, we're on a whole30 cleanse. So no dairy, legumes, grains, or vegetable oils. Potato is okay, but they only had fries.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Came for just a good ole casual dinner with some friends. Menu is too huge for me to make a review on the whole picture, but I liked what I got and want some more!

In honor of seeing Deadpool recently, I grabbed myself a chimichanga with pastor. That baby was just packed with meat. With rice beans and veggies on the plate you'll have a very large meal for a single digit price.

Other items I got were a strawberry agua fresca that was very sweet and refreshing and some corn. Classic seasonings you'd expect - the lime, the spice, the cheese. It's a little slippery and lightly seasoned compared to other takes, but it was still very good and worth 3 bucks. 

It's a solid Mexican joint with great prices and a lot of options. Eat up, bub.
author: Dave N.

description: I tried the Milanesa and it was bomb. I just moved up to SF and I already found a place where the food reminds me of home and my moms cooking.
author: Karina C.

description: Came here based on the reviews and was not disappointed...food was prepared quickly and the portions are quite large.  The food is very tasty.  My wife had the burrito, perfect combination of rice and meat and cheese.  Tons of flavor!  I ordered the fish taco which was also really well done.  We could have just both split the burrito as it was pretty big!  They have an assortment of salsas which were also very good too!  Definitely coming back!
author: Mike R.

description: Solid tacos but not the best I've ever had. Slightly dry chicken and pork. Would recommend the quesadilla and carne asada taco
author: Dylan L.

description: Solid Mexican joint. I recommend the shrimp and steak burrito or the camarones a la diabla.
author: Keith B.

description: The food at this taco shop is offensively bad... They don't even warm the corn tortillas for their tacos so you end up with a brittle, cold, stale tortilla that falls apart the moment you try to pick it up. Also super overpriced. Absolute worst taco shop in a city already filled with bad taco shops... Someone please go to San Diego and learn how to cook real Mexican food and bring it back up to the Bay Area.. I BEG YOU!!!
author: Adam B.

description:
My boyfriend and I love Mexican food, and since I moved to the area, are shocked to say that this might be the best Mexican we've ever had.

Have gotten the burritos (8.5/10), the tacos (10/10) and the quesadillas (10/10), along with the churros (10/10) and the horchata (10/10). The fact that this place is also open late makes it such a star. I've come here more times than I'd like to admit for dinner or lunch, and have nothing but amazing things to say. Quesadillas have for some reason always been what I gravitate towards, and theirs are huge, soo good!

Great prices, fast service, incredibly great food. Only love for El Rancho Grande! Grateful to have it as my local go-to.
author: Abby H.

description: Tacos tacos tacos and quesadillas! They have very friendly service, I recommend trying the ensaladas if you've never had them, but if you want to stick to the classics try the tacos or quesadilla. I recently tried the tostada it was overwhelming to have so much beans/and guacamole on a little shell, so I wouldn't try that again. Pastor tacos, has a spice kick to them, but they're sooo gooooood(:
author: Camille B.

description:
By far my favorite Mexican restaurant in the city. The price for the food is reasonable in accordance to the portion they give you. 

You cannot go wrong with carne asana and al pastor! I absolutely love this place and recommend it to everyone. (:
author: Breanna N.

description: I happen to end up here a lot after a night of clubbing. They're open late, have good prices, and give big portions. I always get the super burrito and it's super :). No complaints from me food wise. However, it can get kind of messy and dirty since lots of people late at night don't clean up after themselves at the tables.
author: Olivia C.

description: The California burrito here is amazing!!!! So are the flautas. The enchiladas though were very bland in a weird tomato sauce.. quick service and great authentic Mexican food (for SF!)
author: Jessica V.

description: Cheap abundant low quality food - we went based on 4 star rating on yelp but we realized that the ravings were due to pricing rather than taste. The place is a dive. We had the chilaquiles and the burrito mojado- guacamole was old, salsa fresca was not fresh and the cilantro was barely there... huge quantities of oil, sour cream and greasy rice and beans - not what we had been hoping for at all... our bad we should have read the reviews before we chose the place rather than just looking at the rating
author: Marci V.

description: Food is okay, but what can I say? Sometimes you just love a great local spot with decent prices. Also, thank you for being the only place open late at night on Divisadero!
author: Russell W.

description: They got some of the best burritos in town! Salsa on point too. Especially the verde and chipotle.
author: Chandra N.

description: Omg omg omg the best steak burrito ever great service as well and the sell tall cans and have ice cold beer mugs if u want Mexican come here this place was amazing
author: Anna T.

description: I was excited to see they had carne asada fries on their menu which is a true rarity in the bay area but the fries were lackluster. Fries were soggy, could barely taste the marinade in the carne asada, and overall not of good quality. Their carne asada tacos were bland too.
author: Briget P.

description: It's not the best Mexican food in the city, but it's pretty damn good. Everyone who works there is very sweet. Carne Asada burrito is one of the best. Beat Mexican place in the area and open late.
author: Ben G.

description: I live right around the corner from this place and I have been going here for the last year. For a go-to late night spot, you can't really beat it. It's not going to be the best cuisine you get in the city, but get their super burrito with Al Pastor and pack up a couple of fresh salsa's and have a good time.
author: Tate B.

description:
I had the chicken chimichanga burrito.  Perfectly deep fried, chicken was moist and delicious, comes with beans and rice and chips!  Such a good deal for under $10!!!!

Bye Little Chihuahua, nice knowing you.  I'll stick with The Big Ranch from now on.
author: Tom N.

description: I eat at El Rancho Grande more than I care to admit and it's always a combination of remorse and pleasure. I've never been here before midnight, so that should tell you a little bit about the type of taqueria it is. They say they are open till 3 AM on weekends, but most of the time they close around 2 AM, which has often caused a lot of drunken strife. The food is pretty average, oily but delicious when you have the drunchies. Their nachos are very satisfying. The portions are huge and their super veggie burrito, my most ordered item, is pretty standard quality. I wouldn't put it on par with  Taqueria Cancun or El Farolito, but It's more than passable and gets the late night cravings taken care of.
author: Shruti S.

description:
Food (4/5) - shrimp quesadilla is sooooo good. Normally I dislike tortillas, but the tortilla here was perfect. It actually reminded me of the roti/chapati you can get from Costco. Crisp on the outside but chewy on the inside, and a flavor that actually complements the filling instead of distracting from it. The shrimp were cooked perfectly! I feel like so many restaurants overcook shrimp but not here. 

The nachos here aren't great, though - the ratio of refried beans to everything else is pretty high, so after a while you're pretty much just eating chips and beans haha. Stick to the quesadillas and burritos!!

Service (n/a) - You just order at the register and they bring it to you, so not really much to say here, but everyone who works there is friendly!

Value (5/5) - My bf and I can split an entree for less than $10 and walk out stuffed, especially since most entrees come with free chips and salsa! Portions are seriously huge here.
author: Abby S.

description: Great customer service, Thanks Lilian!!! It's so nice to be greeted with a smile and spoken to with a now not-so-common manner. I'll be back, definitely!
author: Maya J.

description: I dont usually do reviews but the chimichangas here was too awesome it deserves a few words. Everything was just right for a fair 10$. You even get free chips with an absurd amount of guacamole at the side. The only problem was the humongous portion which I barely finished. But then again I'm just an Asian with humble appetite. Please beware fellow Asians, this thing could easily feed a family of four back in my home country.
author: Minh H.

description: Highly recommend !!! Love the nice Latina cashier at night ! Hi mama!! anywho place is definitely not one to sleep on definitely needs to be partnered with eat24 has many options to choose from especially when it comes to tortilla shells! Garlic is my fave by far. Many condiments and the area usually stays clean. Good for a late night grab as well. Food is usually made pretty fast and has always hit the spot for me. Don't sleep on this place !!!!
author: Coco L.

description:
Came here for a bite before a show at The Independent. I got a basic vegetable burrito because A) they're inexpensive and B) I like to get a taste for the rice and beans of a Mexican joint I haven't been to yet...'cause if you fuck up a basic burrito, I'm not gonna trust your meat.

Bf had a super steak quesadilla...'cause homeboy likes to be all in.

Half an hour goes by and I start feeling queasy at the show but manage to stick it out until the encore set. Not without tons of acid reflux and nausea.

Bae agrees his quesadilla also made him feel not-so-hot. I'd come back here for a taco or two but probably not a burrito again.
author: Megan D.

description:
Best alternative after little chihuahua when closed. 

Had shrimp quesadilla and it was pretty good. Flavorful and they didn't lack on the shrimp portions

I also liked their different tortilla options that you choose from -- spinach, original, wheat and etc

Unlimited salsa bar is always a good thing

They also serve burgers and etc and from what I remember their fries were really good! Crunchy and not too salty

I want more fries!
author: Carol Y.

description: El Rancho tacos are the best. Lots of meat choices and chips and salsa are free! Staff is super friendly and there is pretty bomb Mexican food. My to go place for tacos in the area
author: Doreen C.

description: This is one authentic Mexican spot. You rise at the counter and hey bring it to your table. They have a salsa bar that is as fresh as it gets regarding flavors. The super tacos are huge! I got a chorizo regular taco and carne Assad streak super taco, which was plenty. My husband and I shared a side of small rice and beans which wasn't needed because of how generous the tacos are. They also give you complimentary chips. The sangria was okay; not super strong, but a large pour. Defiantly a hole in the wall where all of the locals go. Would def go back on our next trip to SF
author: Michelle S.

description:
Everything is perfect and I would change nothing.

Oh, except maybe putting the Giants on when they're in season.   But that's it.

Keep it up!
author: Noah D.

description: Was it amazing? No was it good? Yes moist chicken but I think they put too much likes in the salsa, at least I'm hoping because it was sour.
author: Karen T.

description: Lately I've been wandering around without checking yelp first so that I don't miss out on hidden gems.  We were walking down Divesadero and I wanted a burrito so we ended up in El Rancho Grande.  The carnitas burrito was GREAT!  There's a very extensive menu that I wouldn't hesitate to come back to try out.
author: Lyn C.

description:
holy moly! this is a small local spot, away from the tourist throngs. definitely passed the parking lot test, as it was pretty busy on a weekday afternoon. had probably the BEST quesadilla ever. 

the food is amazing, the staff is friendly... go here!
author: Gennady K.

description:
My fiancé and I stopped by before a show at the Independent. We shared a steak plate and some chips/guacamole.

SO FREAKIN' GOOD. We were both so full because it was plenty of food and the marinated meat was yummy for an inexpensive dinner in a rush..

Small whole in the wall joints like this are one reason why I could not live anywhere else besides CA! Teehee
author: Jennifer S. C.

description: The flautas are on POINT!!! They're a little small but they make up for it in taste and CRUNCH!!!
author: Alex C.

description: These are the blandest piece of shit, disguised as food nachos ice ever tasted in my Native San Francisco (GO GIANTS!) life. El Patetico should be the name of this "taqueria". Jokes!
author: Crystal N.

description: Came here for an early dinner! Typically my neighborhood go to is el burrito express, but honestly this place takes the cake! Authentic food and a menu filled with variety! The first time I came I got a steak burrito, not my favorite...however this time I decided to have the crispy taco combination plate! The plate was so delicious! Rice and beans super flavorful and tacos were crispy and chicken inside was tastey! I also love the fact that they have many alcoholic beverage options! I ordered the sangria and it was a great accompaniment to my meal! Will be back!
author: Christiana C.

description: It's not the best taqueria in the city (see Taqueria Vallarta on 24th), but a place in this area that's decently priced and stays open until 3am? Win. This place gets packed around midnight because of all of the people in the area looking for nourishment after imbibing, but they churn out food really quickly, and for those of you who go after tacos when you're befuddled from good drinks, there's an extensive salsa bar. As for me, the El Rancho nachos will do just fine. For less than $10, you get a large stack of fries, cheese, guac, pico, and a meat of your choice. Chorizo is always a solid pick, but their carnitas aren't bad either. The meat is soft and ladled onto your food in large portions. Beer, al pastor, guac, what more can you ask for? You now have a legitimate late-night taqueria on Divis, San Francisco. Well played.
author: Danny C.

description:
Great late night food spot after bar hopping or catching a show!

Staff - accommodating but not friendly.

Decor - dirty, but art on the wall is interesting. Drunk people kept knocking it down so if something looks crooked please fix it.

Food - bomb.com! We had the prawn burrito, fish tacos, and carne asada quesadilla!

Price - fair
author: James T.

description: Something happen to this place. The last visit, one burrito had no beans while the other no rice. One had a large chunk of beef with grizzle attached. Both burritos had a large amount of sharp cheese. When you bring back the old cook, let me know.
author: Thomas B.

description:
With so many taquerias in SF, sometimes I wonder why I bother reviewing them. But I loved this place!

Fish tacos - the fish is seasoned with what tastes like smoked paprika and grilled.  It's just the right amount of spicy and delicious. 

Veggie taco - loaded with lots of good stuff, not lacking in filling like a lot of veggie tacos. A nice layer of cheese between the two corn tortillas.
author: Sona P.

description: I wouldn't eat here ever again. I was expecting a good late night snack, but the food lacked taste and was disappointing. How do you mess up chips and salsa?? The chips were gross and oily. The enchilada platter made me sad.
author: Eliana S.

description: Great California Burrito (I've had it with Carne Asada and Al Pastor, both are amazing).  The salsa bar is filled with some good, addictive salsas.  They also have good options for vegetarians/pescatarians/health-conscious customers.
author: Kasey M.

description:
I love El Rancho's food, I love the people, I love the football and/or soap operas and I love the price. 

I'm a huge fan of both the Californian burrito and the super tacos, but I really haven't regretted ordering anything off the menu.

It's the best Mexican in the area!
author: Jamie W.

description:
1. Get the super quesadilla with steak. 
2. Slather it with salsa verde and habanero. 
3. Grab a friend to share because the portions are pretty huge. 
4. Eat. 
5. Be happy and satisfied.

When El Faralito is too far, this place is a good substitute for your burrito/quesadilla/taco cravings.
author: Cat C.

description: Your authentic SF taqueria! I always get a super veggie burrito and it always tastes amazing! Cheap, yummy food - there's always a line, so it's a pretty popular spot on divis
author: Andreea C.

description: I ordered food and hour before I came by accident and called and asked them to make a new one she said OK I got to the restaurant and she tried to give me that our old nachos and try to make me pay for it again when I wanted to replace it ...then they made a new one for me free but the chicken is burnt and no beans even though I got super nacho and this is just not okay. Burnt chicken for 10$
author: Jasmine M.

description: This place is close to where I was doing some work. Read all the positive reviews online and was a minute away. I arrived to what could seem to many as a shady area. However, the moment you step in, you see the cleanliness of the restaurant, and the scents of fresh tortillas and roasted everything takes over! The food is so yummy. Truly authentic and fresh. They take pride in what they are doing. This place has seating inside, but also great for quick take away. It's super casual. Will go back very soon.
author: charlotte c.

description: They're food is amazing! I find it really hard to locate taquerias that serve genuine and good food here in SF. But, El Rancho Grande beats all the places I have been too and it's fairly priced.
author: Ev R.

description:
Came here lastnight and was really happy to see that they had different tortilla options that you can choose from! 

I had a chiipotle pawn and steak burrito and had to split it with my BF. It was HUGE! But everything was good.

The only reason why it lost one star from me is because I felt that I could have more Pawns in my burrito I only had 4 &&the burrito was huge! Mote pawns next time please! ;)

But the service here is fast and great! Ill deff come back!
author: Porsche C.

description: Oh, El Grouchy Rando. My secret crutch. I keep telling myself I need to stop loading up on chips and tortillas and cheese and rice and beans and chorizo, and yet, somehow, I keep finding myself back here, doing that same thing. It's all I could do to stop drinking the horchatas every day. The food is always decent, occasionally I get lucky and it's great, but it's never, ever bad. They make quesadilla suizas the good way... stuffed full. All the meats are decent enough. The service is pretty quick most of the time, even when it's busy. And it's open when I'm hungry, which is unusual. Not the sort of joint you'd ever think to rave about, I wouldn't call myself a "fan", and yet, I just keep coming back, frequently. There are not many things in this world I can't find anything bad to say about, but El Randy Groucho is one of them, so I guess that makes it pretty good. I like it. I'm glad it's here. El Raunchy Grando, don't ever change.
author: David K.

description: This isn't a chic Mexican restaurant that serves organic blue-corn quesadillas or grass-fed beef tacos with non-GMO sour cream. It's a local taqueria targeted for a very specific crowd. It's nice to witness a taste of Mexico without all the hipster culture typically surrounding Mexican food. And in that regard, El Rancho Grande is one the best I've seen. But nothing is all good, and in this case it was the overpriced food, stale chips, and bland salsas that really brought down the experience. The fish tacos were great, but seemed like a rip-off to me. The mushroom quesadilla was also pretty good, but pretty greasy with partly-melted cheese in some places (that one really bothered me). All in all, not bad, but not an amazing experience for the money.
author: Anonymous R.

description: Satisfactorily tasty and reasonably priced. If you're on a budget and hungry it's good. The super burritos are good too
author: David S.

description:
Moved to the area recently from the Mission and spent my first few months longing for a Mission-style burrito. What am I saying?! That Mission-style's long-gone, replaced by couture shops and sterilized, sex-with-a-condom type burritos (hello Little Chihuahua); there is no more funk to the Mission. 

But my brokenhearted, nostalgic mind digress's. This place is the real deal. Hella TV's blaring Spanish language sports. Beaming fluorescent lights beaming down on the floors still smelling of Pine-Sol. Salsa bar WITH radishes. Most importantly, you can get an excellent burrito for less than $10. Home sweet home.

My only note of skepticism is they have an EXTENSIVE menu for a taqueria sporting caesar salads, philly cheese steaks and hamburgers. Dubious but when it comes to the taqueria-fare, they'll keep it real. 

I've had nachos, burritos and tacos with al pastor, carne asada, cabeza and carnitas and all of them have been good--EXCEPT for the carnitas. I've had three different things with carnitas and they were all disappointing. Most places don't do carnitas well but theirs is particularly dry and bland. Avoid it but enjoy everything else.

Give'em your business and tip them well!
author: Mario T.

description:
We came to El Rancho Grande on the 4th of July post Fireworks.  There wasn't much else open, but it filled the void in my stomach.

I got an al pastor taco, and it was fine.  For the portion and ingredients, I feel like you can find other better and cheaper places during the day.  Nothing special but also nothing wrong with it.  The salsa bar was pretty awesome, though.

I wouldn't come back here, though, after seeing my friend's meals.  Two different people ordered queso dip, and it was actually a melted slice of cheese.  It was really odd.  The burritos were giant, but after tasting one, I wouldn't stray out of SoMa to come back for one either.

The bathrooms were fairly clean at least!

Just A-OK.
author: Amanda J.

description: Came here during lunch hour which means it was pretty busy. They have a great system where they take the orders really fast and also make the food fast . I love all of the condiments they have from different type of sauces to caramelized onions and fried jalapeños. I got the mushroom quesadilla and loved it !!
author: Karen G.

description:
I am really tempted to give this little place 5 stars, but it's fast food, so I can't. 
The first thing you notice when you approach the order counter is one of the most beautiful menu boards I've ever seen, and a Mexican Restaurant like this was my first job and the beginning of 25 years in Food and beverage. 
The second thing you notice is the smiling happy friendly young lady behind the counter, that although she's very busy, manages to accomplish her job perfectly, all the while seeming to really love her job. 
I had the prawns burrito, a personal favorite, with no salsa and easy on the rice. It was prepared perfectly and sublimely delicious. The prawns were so large it would be impossible to consume a whole one in one bite. It wasn't until I was packing up the other half of my burrito that I realized how exceptional my experience had been. 
So I said thank you to the nice still smiling young lady that was single handedly managing the front of the house, and she almost laughed when I told how much I enjoyed the food. I wonder if she hears that a lot, probably does. 
This is not my usual haunt but I will be going out of my way to come here a lot.
author: Monte H.

description: Legendary chimichangas! My girlfriend and I have come here twice in the last week. They also have great salsa and fresh lines out for your convenience. This is a great place for getting fresh Mexican food, I certainly would recommend it to anyone.
author: Mac J.

description: We really enjoyed the super burrito and the taco, both with al pastor. Would definitely go back!
author: Mackenzie L.

description: Was literally the best California burrito I have ever had, and I'm from LA. Very authentic, many items here to choose from, and great side condiments at the salsa bar. Also any place that gives u a side of chips with your order for free is winning in my book. Would come back here no questions asked.
author: Ryan A.

description:
Hands down, my favorite Mexican spot in the city.

Gotta love the salsa bar with the spicy carrots and pickled jalapeño. Bomb.com para siempre! 

I always get the super quesadilla with chicken... its huge and definitely hits the spot.
author: Lauren B.

description:
There is not a decent burrito joint west of this place. If you are down at the beach, this is how far you will need to go to get the real deal.

The salsa bar is excellent.

Free chips.

The Al Pastor has a real barbecue flavor.

Good prices.

Friendly staff.

Open late.
author: Andy B.

description: Not the best Mexican food. Ordered a tostada and it came w steak, I tried to take it back bc I didn't want meat. The menu states "meat of any choice" looks like they decided for me. Besides the crummy service, I wouldn't come back bc it wasn't the best tasting food for Mexican
author: Celeste V.

description: Had a killer delish chimichanga here last night. Fair prices, tasty food, clean restaurant. Would definitely come back.
author: Luke G.

description:
This place used to be my late-night grub spot since it is only four blocks away, but its food quality can be anywhere from awesome, and apparently, all the way down to "WTF is this sh*t?!"  

I always grab carne asada super burritos and they're usually good.  The salsa bar is great since they've expanded it.  

I recently got a shrimp super burrito and the shrimp was disgusting!  It was hard and smelled horrible. 

Serve f*cking fresh food all the time you *ssholes!

Thanks for the years of decent food, but your quality is all over the place and I don't have time to gamble on your choice to serve crap sometimes.
author: John M.

description: Posted hours until 3AM , but turned away at 2:30AM. Can't comment on the food since I never got to actually have anything ...
author: Alexander R.

description:
Overall, this is a high-quality tacqueria, and I might even say it's the one of the best Mexican food.  Everything that I have had here is better than average, and all the fixings are fresh and delicious.  and in my opinion, their huevos rancheros and their ranchero salsa is the best that I've had in SF.

I live nearby, so I eat there dozens of times a year.  I've tried their super burritos, tacos, super nachos, flautas, tamales, chile rellenos, quesadillas, california burritos, wet burritos, and huevos rancheros.  I would love to explore more of the menu, but my cravings for the above-mentioned food items keep me from doing so.

As I mentioned, their salsa ranchera at the salsa bar is amazing, and their free chips are usually pretty good, but sometimes stale.

I hesitate to give it 5 stars only because the dining in area is not great.
author: Justin L.

description: As soon as I walked in I was greeted immediately. The menu is super easy to read with a MILLION choices. I decided on the super burrito. 9$ - a little aggressive for a burrito, but the meal was done and under 4 minutes!!!! The fastest food I have ever received. Although the burrito was average size( not like Chipotles, much smaller) but the whole experience was awesome. Complete salsa bar and was given free chips.
author: Lauren C.

description: Best burrito spot in SF. The wet burrito with BBQ chicken is my favorite. They have a huge salsa bar with lots of different salsa there is bound to be one you will love.
author: Brennan F.

description:
Just moved to Alamo Square, and was stoked to see a $ burrito joint pretty much at my doorstep.

Reasons this burrito was basically the best burrito I've had in SF:

-Even distribution of all ingredients
-Tasty carne asada
-Grilled the burrito, which as a result, the cheese was melted and the tortilla was slightly crispy
-Salsa bar: 4 types. High quality salsa verde, which is lovely.

BRAVO EL RANCHO GRANDE! BRAVO!
author: Joe H.

description: Not even close.  I ordered the cabeza and lengua tacos.  They were tasteless and poorly prepared.  The meat was left in large chunks that were dry and had no flavor.  I also ordered the menudo.  I made better menudo when I was 12.  This too was watery, tasteless and was mostly pig foot.  The tripe that there was in the serving, was so large I had to cut it in five pieces before I could eat it.  Not even close to authentic or worthy to be called Mexican Food.
author: Jose R.

description: This place has the DANKEST re fried beans. I'm not sure how they do it, but this place has the best beans I've ever had. I always get the super nachos and the portion size is crazy. You get SO MUCH FOOD. Only downside to this place is that there is no soda machine and after they redid their sign diet coke went from $1 a can to $1.45 a can -___-....
author: Kevin K.

description:
I am giving this place five stars because of its excellent service!!

I am a Spanish teacher in a middle school near by. My students were learning how to order food from a restaurant and after practicing their new vocabulary the students suggested to come here and order some food in Spanish to try their new skills. I thought that was a great idea, so I called the taqueria explaining that I wanted to bring a class of 25 students to order some food in Spanish, the lady that picked up the phone was really nice and was on board with our idea. 

A week later, we came to the restaurant and the cashier and the waiter were super nice and helpful with my students. They only spoke Spanish to the students, forcing the students to practice their Spanish vocabulary. All the kids enjoyed their delicious food; you could see them all happily eating their giant nachos, burritos and/or churros.
My students were so happy and excited to be there! 

I am so grateful to the employees of this restaurant for hosting us and for being so helpful in our activity! This is one experience that my students will never forget.

¡Gracias El Rancho Grande Taqueria!
author: Luna A.

description:
What are these reviewers smoking? This place is an insult to taquerias. 

I've lived across the street from this place for three years and it just continually gets worse. Low grade ingredients and cooks who clearly could not give any care to the quality they produce. The front cashiers are always nice, so for that they get the one star.

It's a typical place for drunken yahoos (myself included in that from time to time) to get a late night bite to eat. This has to be their main clientele and why they really could care less about the quality as any one sober enough wouldn't feed their burritos to a pet.

I boycotted the lace a year ago when they burnt my burrito, but last night, after the festivities of halloween I found myself a bit desperate and gave them another chance... to my amazement they actually burnt that burrito too.

No more. This neighborhood deserves a better, affordable Taqueria, this place needs to go. Look at what Street Taco on Haight is doing for the same prices and it will boggle your mind at how Rancho Grande can keep up their business with this tripe.

Also, lately, which is maybe not really up to the restaurant, but sewage has been leaking out onto the sidewalk from the door next door(but where they have their garbage bins, not sure if it's related, either way, makes the whole thing even more disgusting.
author: Matt M.

description:
OK, I admit. I am a bit biased in my reviews because I ONLY go to places that are AMAZING. So, simply put. THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. It's so flavorful. Take it from me, a burrito-holic. I've looked all thought-out of CA to discover the best burrito. This ranks top 5.

1. You can tell a good mexican spot by the beans, no good beans no good.
2. Variety
3. The meat options - seafood is always a plus
4. Deal-breaker, chips and salsa
5. Hot salsa
6. The beer

:D

Happy tummy.
author: Shante E.

description: This is a FANTASTIC taqueria. Lots of great vegetarian options and the most delicious nachos you have ever experienced. To top it off, it's also open till 3 am! Perfect for the drunchies. Go here ASAP
author: Amaresh S.

description:
This brand new taqueria opened up in the Western Addition with very little hoopla about two weeks ago.  I'd been working on a volunteer project in that area recently and passed by on several occasions.  On Saturday afternoon on my way to the volunteer site I decided to hit up on nearby Green Chile Kitchen, but the place was packed and there was a line of people at the door.  That's when I remembered about the new place which is less than three blocks away.

El Rancho Grande was fairly empty at the time.  Two parties were eating inside and another three customers were waiting for takeout orders.  This restaurant has a huge menu that is mounted on a wall behind the order counter.  I had to study it for a bit before I got in line to place my order.

I decided to go with an enchilada plate with carnitas.  Rice, beans, lettuce, guacamole and pico de gallo are included on the plate.  There were no choice in beans which was a slight disappointment because as many of you know I only eat whole black beans.  I ordered a fish taco also and a bottle of Jarritos even though the agua frescas looked very good.  The friendly lady behind the counter asked if I wanted chips (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VKPA24jl5g19ESyA9tN8Vw?select=-FA-_2AKcGXCjQi-EMtVjg) and I accepted.  There is a complimentary salsa bar with containers of pico de gallo, a tomatillo salsa, a red salsa and whole pickled peppers on ice.  Once I paid my check the lady asked me to take a seat and said she would bring me my order.

That she did beginning with the big Enchiladas Plate (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VKPA24jl5g19ESyA9tN8Vw?select=qNKMVxkPe_WxiN5mJscsnA).  Everything on the plate was nice and fresh and the enchiladas had quite a bit of carnitas inside including some fairly large pieces (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VKPA24jl5g19ESyA9tN8Vw?select=Yg3PAheoQ2Z9G04ntjA3PA).  The carnitas were very good.  The pork was very lean, moist and tender and the edges were nice and crispy like many of us enjoy in fried pork.  Don't ask me how the refried beans were because I didn't eat them, but I did eat everything else on the plate.

The Fish Taco (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VKPA24jl5g19ESyA9tN8Vw?select=-v1qpO_oKE6pGzx-TGde-A) was unlike any fish taco I've had before.  On two mini soft corn tortillas were several big pieces of grilled white fish (possibly tilapia), some chopped white onions, a mound of cilantro and a somewhat spicy brown sauce that had tomatillos in it.  The fish itself was excellent, and I loved all of the fresh cilantro and the sauce, but as good as it was I think I still prefer Baja style fish tacos.

Another reviewer had posted a nice shot of the wall menu in the photos section, but I decided to add images of the scanned take-out menu anyway since the restaurant doesn't have a website yet.  For Soups, Salads, Tortas, Tacos, Burritos and Quesadillas (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VKPA24jl5g19ESyA9tN8Vw?select=A-ugSGp99hwDc-rer25FpA), for Types of Meats, Nachos, Breakfast Plates, Special Plates, Sandwiches and Burgers (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VKPA24jl5g19ESyA9tN8Vw?select=vkGK-QVB6D4PrKibNxcbSQ), and finally for Side Orders, Extras, Agua Frescas, Juices and Beverages (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VKPA24jl5g19ESyA9tN8Vw?select=Cj14DkQOkN_hDqGuxZsvZw).

I wish them well, and I'm certain I'll be back when I'm in the area again.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: Got the mushroom quesadilla, quite good. My friends enjoyed their tacos. The overall environment of the place was that of a great neighborhood place, and I love that it's open a little late for the occasional late night meal. Will be back!
author: Vishnu R.

description:
I am not sure how to go about writing this review. It was late, I was hungry driving down Divisadero St. I saw this place and I pulled over to do a little research on yelp. "Three and half stars how bad can this place be" I asked myself plus it was late, I was there and I had to get going.

I ordered a California burrito since it's a rare item I've seen on a Nor Cal Mexican food shop's menu. I had thoughts of my glory days of eating California burrito in San Diego which made me all giddy. 

"Could this be the one item that yelp reviewers missed?" "have I stumble a upon a burrito secret?". Wrong!    

Something was wrong from the beginning as I looked on how they were preparing the asada meat for the California burrito. I couldn't help notice the color and texture of the meat. It was different from any other times I've eaten at a Mexican food restaurants. (And yes I am a Burrito Snob, I have Burrito credentials lol) the meat looked odd and mushy. 

I asked cashier if I could have some salsa to go she point toward the cold counter covered with thick plastic grey covers. I asked the cashier if I could have a spoon she said to use the little plastic cups as a spoon. Huh? okay.(Moot point)

With the first bite I knew something with different with the burrito and it was the Meat! My burrito palate and nose was not liking it. However the hot sauce I was digging (one Star) and gave me a hint of maybe were the owners style of cooking is from. The salsa is very Yucatan.

After awhile I started to feel nauseous and it was the meat that did it. 

I don't blame restaurant for my experience however I blame myself for coming here by trusting a few Yelps who probably don't know what good Cali-Mex food is. 

I have to remember in SF there is a huge job hiring in the tech industry which is creating a population boom in SF. Most of these people who are coming in from all corners of the US probably haven't been exposed to good authentic Mexican food and then yelp about their SF experience.

Next time I'll be little more cautions where I go or ask a local and cross reference with yelp.
author: Abel S.

description:
This place is THE BEST taqueria in SF and hardly anyone knows it!! My husband and I drive all the way over from Nob Hill when we're jonesin for nachos, burritos, you name it! Their veggie nachos and grilled veggie burritos are so flavorful. My husband is obsessed with their steak nachos. I've tried several items and have never been disappointed.

Their salsa bar is worth mentioning. 5 or so different salsas, jalapenos, onions...all the fixings you could ever want from a salsa bar. I wish the salsa to-go cups were bigger, but people would probably take five times the salsa so I get it.

Don't be put off by Rancho's outward appearance, THE FOOD IS TO DIE FOR. The staff is friendly enough and this is legit taqueria food. Oh my gosh I have to go there NOW.
author: Kaylie P.

description:
This place is AWESOME. My favorite burrito place in the city. I probably go there at least once every couple of weeks. I'm sure part of that has to do with it's convenience to my location, but the the burritos themselves are exceptional by any standards. They're massive too, and cheap, so if you're jonesing for a full stomach and a full wallet, you should check it out. They also have killer quesadillas and pretty bomb enchiladas. They aren't skimpy with their guac, either. The super burritos and super quesadillas have piles of that delicious miracle-sauce inside of them. 

They have all of the meat choices you'd expect as well; carne asada, al pastor, carnitas, lengua, cabeza, as well as insanely delicious breakfast options like chorizo and egg. Chips come free with everything!

Their beverage selection is great too, with all sorts of flavors of Jarritos sodas, Mexican colas, and beers like Modelo. 

Break that hunger without breaking the bank and check this place out. You'll be a regular after the first visit.
author: Addison S.

description: We love their burritos- it's always packed so I'm guessing their food is fresh because of all the turnover. The horchata is also surprisingly delicious and is so sweet that it lasts us for days
author: Ron M.

description:
They have the best carne asada in San Francisco. 
This place is netter than any other mission burrito spot.
author: Blake G.

description: Oh man this is by far better than any "farolito" really good burritos, they have variety. The salsa bar is spot on.
author: Mario R.

description: Too many other Mexicali type places in the hood to recommend choosing this place over the 2 others nearby. Good for late night snacks.
author: Raylan W.

description:
I don't know what you're expecting, but if it's quick, delicious, cheap Mexican food, this is your spot. 

FOOD:

It's about as high quality $ Mexican food as you're going to get. It comes out super quick, the prices are right, and I've never had a bad meal there. Their carnitas is super good, and if you're willing to wait (or call it in ahead), get the Pozole, It's some of the best I've had. Two complaints: their chips are a little stale, and it would be nice if they had a little bit bigger selection in their salsa bar

SERVICE:

Fine, the ladies working the register are super nice, and the food comes out fast.
author: Patrick T.

description:
This place is the **ex-girlfriend of Mexican food establishments. You know you want no part of it, but occasionally you find yourself inebriated and needing a quick fix, so you lower your standards and pop in for an ill-advised visit. Then, upon masticating, you quickly realize how big of a mistake it was to swim in those waters again, and vow never to return ever, ever again.

**Of course, this is completely theoretical.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I love their chorizo and it's delicious in tacos. Great flour tortillas for burritos and a great selection of flour tortilla alternatives. 

Recently on the fence about their Carne Asada.

California Burittos are bomb.

Rolled flautas are amazing and you get a great amount. 

My man enjoys the vegetarian tacos and vegetarian burritos with roasted veggies. 

I only wish they would make Agua de  Jamaica.
author: Isidro M.

description: Poor customer service in the evening ! I've been a loyal customer since they opened now the new cooks are getting the orders wrong all the time and the young lady at the counter has a nasty attitude .  I'm much happier eating at burrito express down at Bush and Divisadero
author: Ronald S.

description: Holy bananas - I had an al pastor super burrito without rice here this weekend and it blew my mind. Not sure if they put some sort of special sauce, but the inside looked kind of creamy (?) and tasted super rich. I was very happy for all the moments I ate this/did not have a heart attack. :P Looking forward to trying other/different meats here!
author: Shendi X.

description: The super tacos are probably one of those underrated menu items, or I guess I just love guacamole. I like this taqueria a lot, is reliable and the price is very fair.
author: Plinio C.

description: Delicious. My favorites are the enchiladas with chicken in salsa, milanese, or really anything. The burritos are delicious. Salsa is spicy as it should be. Best horchata around. Open late...What more could you ask for?
author: Anne L.

description: Solid quick Mexican place.  The food is decent in quality and the location is prime.  Not the best Mexican you've ever had but for the price it doesn't disappoint.  The staff is always friendly and it never takes too long to get your food.  This is not a destination spot but if you're in the area and have a craving for some Mexican then give this place a try!
author: Jamie B.

description: When i first got here i thought the place was a bit pricey for a kind of hole in the wall taqueria, but then i realized it's because their portions are MASSIVE. I tried the super veggie taco, it was pretty good. Some friends split the nachos, which I don't know how a single person could eat - it was a ton of food. Excited to come back here and try more of their selection. I just have to make sure I'm super hungry!
author: Amaresh S.

description: Quick and inexpensive Mexican food. If your looking for a super burrito for 8 bucks in Nopa then this is the place.
author: Ben G.
